name: collector field area construction, solar tower power plant, 20 MW | collector field area, solar tower power plant, 20 MW | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19910/documentation

This activity represents the construction of large two-axis tracked mirrors that are installed around a receiver tower to serve as component of a solar tower power plant in Upington, South Africa. These slightly curved mirrors are also called heliostats; a computer calculates the ideal position for each of these, and a motor drive moves them according to sunshine . The total collector field area amounts to 215'520 m2. Total land use for the concentrated solar power plant is accounted for in the dataset "concentrated solar power plant construction, solar tower, 20 MW". ;This dataset is entirely based on the detailed life cycle inventory as presented in the dissertation report by ;Telsnig, Thomas. 2015. Standortabhängige Analyse und Bewertung solarthermischer Kraftwerke am Beispiel Südafrikas. Forschungsbericht. Band 123. ISSN 0938-1228. Institut für Energiewirtschaft und Rationelle Energieanwendung, Universität Stuttgart, Germany. 

The activity starts with the construction of the mirrors. It includes operationalization and maintenance of the heliostats to transfer the sunlight onto a receiver.

Total land use for the CSP plant is accounted for in the dataset "concentrated solar power plant construction, solar tower, 20 MW". 

The activity concludes after setting up the entire heliostat field with the respective wire connectivity for power, monitoring and maintenance.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/422:Construction of utility projects/4220:Construction of utility projects

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset has been extrapolated from a dataset modelled for the location Upington, South Africa. Uncertainty has not been adjusted as it is assumed that the modelled 20 MW solar tower power plant would be very similar in other parts of the world.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset has been extrapolated from a dataset modelled for the location Upington, South Africa. The original data modelling a 440 MW power plant have been scaled down with parameter specific linear and non-linear equations to represent a 20 MW plant design. Uncertainty has not been adjusted as it is assumed that the modelled 20 MW solar tower power plant would be very similar in other parts of the world.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
This dataset is entirely based on the detailed life cycle inventory as presented in the dissertation report by 
Telsnig, Thomas. 2015. Standortabhängige Analyse und Bewertung solarthermischer Kraftwerke am Beispiel Südafrikas. Forschungsbericht. Band 123. ISSN 0938-1228. Institut für Energiewirtschaft und Rationelle Energieanwendung, Universität Stuttgart, Germany. 

Further, data in Telsnig 2015 are not shown explicitely for the downscaled 20 MW solar tower power plant. This gap is filled in the ecoinvent report.

flow.name: collector field area, solar tower power plant, 20 MW
flow.category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/422:Construction of utility projects/4220:Construction of utility projects
